cont.entity_a: Heats the room well. Provides a lot of heat without using too much electricity. Units heat up quickly and quietly. Not suitable for heating a 100 sq ft area as primary heat.
cont.entity_b: Heats the bathroom quickly. Throws out a lot of heat quickly. Not strong enough for larger spaces, suitable for small rooms.

cont.entity_a: Installation instructions are clear and easy to read. Pre-drilling holes is recommended for easier installation.
cont.entity_b: Lacks a knockout clamp for wiring. Works great but requires an electrician for installation.

cont.entity_a: Works well with Sinope web programmable thermostats. Connected to a Honeywell line voltage thermostat and works great.
cont.entity_b: Thermostat activates even when off if temperature drops to mid-forties. Thermostat was not included despite being advertised. Thermostat wore out after 10 months, causing continuous operation.

cont.entity_a: Failed after just over 4 years, which is considered short. Some units fail in under two years. Quality is not consistent; some units last only a few years.
Safe around young children and pets.
cont.entity_b: Electrical parts are not protected, risking clogging in dirty environments.

cont.entity_a: Some units produce noise after several years of use. No noise or popping during operation. Some units are noisy, requiring ear plugs.
Fits perfectly with exact measurements as stated. Hard wired to a 240V line and performs well. Misleading information about voltage; not portable as it requires hard wiring.
cont.entity_b: No temperature control; heat rises rather than directed downward. Same footprint as older Cadet heaters.

cont.entity_a: Customer service was efficient in replacing a unit under warranty.
Handling and packing could be improved to prevent minor damages.
